body_html:
@goodlux Thanks. I also think that 2 is better. For the above example, my guess is that it is a multiline issue causing \left to not matched with the \right on the next line. Probably just line continuation would work, i.e.

      .. math::
          D_{out} = \left\lfloor\frac{D_{in} + 2 * \text{padding}[0] - \text{dilation}[0] \
                * (\text{kernel_size}[0] - 1) - 1}{\text{stride}[0]} + 1\right\rfloor

          H_{out} = \left\lfloor\frac{H_{in} + 2 * \text{padding}[1] - \text{dilation}[1] \
                * (\text{kernel_size}[1] - 1) - 1}{\text{stride}[1]} + 1\right\rfloor

          W_{out} = \left\lfloor\frac{W_{in} + 2 * \text{padding}[2] - \text{dilation}[2] \
                * (\text{kernel_size}[2] - 1) - 1}{\text{stride}[2]} + 1\right\rfloor

Could you try it?
body_text:
@goodlux Thanks. I also think that 2 is better. For the above example, my guess is that it is a multiline issue causing \left to not matched with the \right on the next line. Probably just line continuation would work, i.e.
      .. math::
          D_{out} = \left\lfloor\frac{D_{in} + 2 * \text{padding}[0] - \text{dilation}[0] \
                * (\text{kernel_size}[0] - 1) - 1}{\text{stride}[0]} + 1\right\rfloor

          H_{out} = \left\lfloor\frac{H_{in} + 2 * \text{padding}[1] - \text{dilation}[1] \
                * (\text{kernel_size}[1] - 1) - 1}{\text{stride}[1]} + 1\right\rfloor

          W_{out} = \left\lfloor\frac{W_{in} + 2 * \text{padding}[2] - \text{dilation}[2] \
                * (\text{kernel_size}[2] - 1) - 1}{\text{stride}[2]} + 1\right\rfloor

Could you try it?
body:
@goodlux Thanks. I also think that 2 is better. For the above example, my guess is that it is a multiline issue causing \left to not matched with the \right on the next line. Probably just line continuation would work, i.e. 
```
      .. math::
          D_{out} = \left\lfloor\frac{D_{in} + 2 * \text{padding}[0] - \text{dilation}[0] \
                * (\text{kernel_size}[0] - 1) - 1}{\text{stride}[0]} + 1\right\rfloor

          H_{out} = \left\lfloor\frac{H_{in} + 2 * \text{padding}[1] - \text{dilation}[1] \
                * (\text{kernel_size}[1] - 1) - 1}{\text{stride}[1]} + 1\right\rfloor

          W_{out} = \left\lfloor\frac{W_{in} + 2 * \text{padding}[2] - \text{dilation}[2] \
                * (\text{kernel_size}[2] - 1) - 1}{\text{stride}[2]} + 1\right\rfloor
```

Could you try it?
